definition: on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
like a dog who fell in the river and climbs out—shaking all over

sentences.english: They can nest up to eight times in a season, producing up to 800 eggs.
sentences.chinese: 一季中，它們可以上岸8次，產卵多達800枚。

sentences.english: He hitched his boat to a tree when he landed.
sentences.chinese: 他一上岸就把小船系在了一棵樹上。

sentences.english: No lives were lost, and we could wade ashore in safety.
sentences.chinese: 人都安然無恙，我們都能平安地涉水上岸。

sentences.english: He came out from the water immediately, climbed up the bank, and made off for home at once.
sentences.chinese: 他迅速浮出水面，上岸後撒腿就往家跑。

sentences.english: It was incredible. They reached the shore and were shivering and nervous.
sentences.chinese: 剛一上岸，他倆顯得相當緊張，並且止不住的發抖。

sentences.english: Numerous fairy people gallop to disembark.
Theseus led the virgin in Crete went ashore.
sentences.chinese: 忒修斯領着童男童女在克里特上岸了。

sentences.english: Only those pre-booked on Malacca excursions may disembark.
sentences.chinese: 惟有已預定馬六甲上岸觀光活動的乘客方可下船。

sentences.english: The young man asked him to show how to operate that machine.
sentences.chinese: 把這年輕人帶上岸並指給他去勞務市場的路。

sentences.english: And the rest, some on boards, some on broken pieces of the ship.
sentences.chinese: 其餘的人，可以用板子，或船上的零碎東西上岸。

sentences.english: The bears couldn’t make it to shore, as the sea ice was several hundred miles offshore when it ice broke up.
sentences.chinese: 這些熊沒有辦法上岸，海冰離岸數百英里冰就破碎了。

sentences.english: He had sailed round New Zealand and up the east coast of Australia.
sentences.chinese: 他們航行於新西蘭一帶，於澳大利亞的東海岸上岸。

sentences.english: I felt pretty decent coming out of the swim, which I was happy with.
sentences.chinese: 當我結束這段樂在其中的游泳上岸時，感覺相當好。

sentences.english: Hunter and I came ashore to see what was happening, and found the stockade .
sentences.chinese: 我和亨特上岸想看看發生了什麼，卻發現了這個寨子。

sentences.english: If the flow of the beaches is gentle, the water energy is lessened as it washes up along the shore.
sentences.chinese: 如果海灘漲潮和緩，海水沖刷上岸時水能就會減少。

sentences.english: He went ashore at every port.
sentences.chinese: 每到一個港口他都上岸。

definition: (of a boat) to reach the shore/to pull toward shore/close to shore/landfall
to fall into water/to sink/overboard/fig. to degenerate/to sink (into depravity)/to go to the dogs
downstream/to go into the water/to put into water/to launch (a ship)/fig. to fall into bad ways/to lead astray/to go to pot
to salvage/to dredge/to fish out (person or object from the sea)
to embark/to travel by ship/to ferry
